title: Wrong Raw Material in Standard Mix
vignette: A bakery order calls for rye flour but the baker mistakenly uses wheat.

options.text: Reject it and require the correct grain.
Accept it since both are grain offerings.

title: Missing Measuring Cup for Oil
vignette: The chef eyeballs the oil because the kitchen's only measure is missing.

options.text: Proceed; slight deviation is fine.
Stop until a proper measure is found.

title: Salt omitted from the offering
vignette: In haste, no salt is added to the meal-offering before burning.

options.text: Add salt afterward and continue.
The omission invalidates it; bring another.

title: Damaged Container for Spices
vignette: The ramekin holding garnish cracks mid-plating.

options.text: Transfer it to an intact vessel before offering.
Use the cracked bowl since the contents remain clean.

title: Public vs. Private Donation Mix-up
vignette: Two labelled food-bank hampers get merged and tags fall off.

options.text: Treat both as public to avoid personal gain.
Split them evenly and continue.

title: Wave offering performed by a minor
vignette: A young boy assists and waves the offering with the senior professional.

options.text: Valid if an adult supervises.
Only an adult may perform the ritual act.

title: Doubtful Parchment for Official Certificates
vignette: Certificates are printed on leather whose sourcing is uncertain.

options.text: Use them; the doubt is minor.
They are invalid; write new ones on verified parchment.

title: Seasonal Shortage for Annual Grant
vignette: A community crop failure leaves barely enough grain for the traditional spring food-drive.

options.text: Offer the smaller amount anyway.
Delay until a full measure is available.

title: Handful taken by left hand
vignette: The senior professional forgets and takes the flour handful with his left hand instead of the right.

options.text: Accept it since intent was proper.
It must be retaken with the right hand.

title: Late Designation of Gift Items
vignette: A patron bakes 50 cupcakes, then decides to enter them into a charity auction *after* baking.

options.text: Still acceptable if he sets them aside afterward.
Invalid; they must be consecrated before baking.

title: Wrong Container Noticed Mid-Mix
vignette: Halfway through, the barista realises the espresso shots were drawn into the wrong jug.

options.text: Pour it into the correct vessel and proceed.
Start over with new oil in the proper bowl.

title: Volunteer brings extravagant offering
vignette: A wealthy donor insists on a double portion despite the standard size.

options.text: Permit it to encourage generosity.
Limit him to the usual amount.

title: Early-Ripened Produce vs. Release Date
vignette: A farmer's strawberries ripen before the market's "new season" launch date.

options.text: Wait until the omer before using it.
Use it now to avoid spoilage.

title: Leftover frankincense after burning
vignette: A small pile of frankincense remains unburned on the main platform.

options.text: Burn it immediately though the main offering is done.
Leave it to burn itself out naturally.

title: Financial Hardship After Making a Pledge
vignette: Donor promises â‚¬1 000, then loses her job before paying.

options.text: He must fulfill the vow despite the cost.
He may annul the vow to avoid hardship.
